column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/bulbasaur-2.gif|{"Grass"
column2: "Poison"}|"Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun''s rays

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/ivysaur-3.gif|{"Grass"
column2: "Poison"}|"There is a bud on this Pokémon''s back. To support its weight
column3: Ivysaur''s legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight
column4: it''s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon."|{"Bulbasaur"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/venusaur-female.gif|{"Grass"
column2: "Poison"}|"There is a large flower on Venusaur''s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower''s aroma soothes the emotions of people."|{"Bulbasaur"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/charmander-3.gif|{"Fire"}|"The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged
column2: the flame burns fiercely."|{"Charmander"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/charmeleon-2.gif|{"Fire"}|"Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe
column2: it turns aggressive. In this excited state
column3: the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color."|{"Charmander"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/charizard-4.gif|{"Fire"}|"Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However
column2: it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself."|{"Charmander"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/squirtle-2.gif|{"Water"}|"Squirtle''s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water
column2: enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds."|{"Squirtle"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/wartortle-3.gif|{"Water"}|"Its tail is large and covered with a rich
column2: thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon''s toughness as a battler."|{"Squirtle"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/blastoise-3.gif|{"Water"}|"Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet."|{"Squirtle"
column2: "Wartortle"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/caterpie-2.gif|{"Bug"}|"Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna
column2: this Pokémon releases a terrifically strong odor."|{"Caterpie"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/metapod.gif|{"Bug"}|"The shell covering this Pokémon''s body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell."|{"Caterpie"
column2: "Metapod"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/butterfree.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Flying"}|"Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out
column4: and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest."|{"Caterpie"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/weedle.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Poison"}|"Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose)."|{"Weedle"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/kakuna.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Poison"}|"Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However
column4: it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch."|{"Weedle"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/beedrill.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Poison"}|"Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered
column3: they will attack in a furious swarm."|{"Weedle"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/pidgey.gif|{"Normal"
column2: "Flying"}|"Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest
column3: however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings."|{"Pidgey"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/pidgeotto.gif|{"Normal"
column2: "Flying"}|"Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around
column3: patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated
column4: it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws."|{"Pidgey"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/pidgeot-2.gif|{"Normal"
column2: "Flying"}|"This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head
column3: compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon."|{"Pidgey"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/rattata.gif|{"Normal"}|"Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep
column2: it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere."|{"Rattata"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/raticate.gif|{"Normal"}|"Raticate''s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down
column2: it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses."|{"Rattata"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/spearow-2.gif|{"Flying"}|"Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high
column2: keening cry is heard echoing all around
column3: it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger."|{"Spearow"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/fearow.gif|{"Flying"}|"Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey."|{"Spearow"
column2: "Fearow"}

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/ekans.gif|{"Poison"}|"Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head."|{"Ekans"
column2: "Arbok"}

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/arbok.gif|{"Poison"}|"This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe
column2: escaping its crunching embrace is impossible."|{"Ekans"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/pikachu-2.gif|{"Electric"}|"Whenever Pikachu comes across something new
column2: it blasts it with a jolt of electricity. If you come across a blackened berry
column3: it''s evidence that this Pokémon mistook the intensity of its charge."|{"Pikachu"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/raichu-2.gif|{"Electric"}|"If the electrical sacs become excessively charged
column2: Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pokémon''s nest."|{"Pikachu"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/sandshrew.gif|{"Ground"}|"Sandshrew''s body is configured to absorb water without waste
column2: enabling it to survive in an arid desert. This Pokémon curls up to protect itself from its enemies."|{"Sandshrew"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/sandslash.gif|{"Ground"}|"Sandslash''s body is covered by tough spikes
column2: which are hardened sections of its hide. Once a year
column4: to be replaced with new spikes that grow out from beneath the old ones."|{"Sandshrew"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/nidoranf.gif|{"Poison"}|"Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged
column2: it releases a horrible toxin from its horn."|{"Nidoran ♀"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/nidorina.gif|{"Poison"}|"When Nidorina are with their friends or family
column2: they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others."|{"Nidoran ♀"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/nidoqueen.gif|{"Poison"}|"Nidoqueen''s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young."|{"Nidoran ♀"
column2: "Nidorina"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/nidoranm.gif|{"Poison"}|"Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them
column2: the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon's notice."|{"Nidoran ♂"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/nidorino.gif|{"Poison"}|"Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence
column2: all the barbs on its back bristle up at once
column3: and it challenges the foe with all its might."|{"Nidoran ♂"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/nidoking.gif|{"Poison"}|"Nidoking''s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing
column2: it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/clefairy.gif|{"Fairy"}|"On every night of a full moon
column2: groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives
column3: the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other."|{"Clefairy"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/clefable.gif|{"Fairy"}|"Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet
column2: moonlit nights."|{"Clefairy"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/vulpix.gif|{"Fire"}|"At the time of its birth
column2: Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled."|{"Vulpix"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/ninetales-3.gif|{"Fire"}|"Ninetales casts a sinister light from its bright red eyes to gain total control over its foe''s mind. This Pokémon is said to live for a thousand years."|{"Vulpix"
column2: "Ninetales"}

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/jigglypuff.gif|{"Fairy"
column2: "Normal"}|"Jigglypuff''s vocal cords can freely adjust the wavelength of its voice. This Pokémon uses this ability to sing at precisely the right wavelength to make its foes most drowsy."|{"Jigglypuff"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/wigglytuff.gif|{"Fairy"
column2: "Normal"}|"Wigglytuff has large
column3: saucerlike eyes. The surfaces of its eyes are always covered with a thin layer of tears. If any dust gets in this Pokémon's eyes

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/zubat-2.gif|{"Poison"
column2: "Flying"}|"Zubat remains quietly unmoving in a dark spot during the bright daylight hours. It does so because prolonged exposure to the sun causes its body to become slightly burned."|{"Zubat"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/golbat-2.gif|{"Poison"
column2: "Flying"}|"Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in the night skies

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/oddish.gif|{"Grass"
column2: "Poison"}|"During the daytime
column3: Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/gloom.gif|{"Grass"
column2: "Poison"}|"Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger
column3: the stench worsens. If this Pokémon is feeling calm and secure
column4: it does not release its usual stinky aroma."|{"Oddish"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/vileplume.gif|{"Grass"
column2: "Poison"}|"Vileplume''s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That''s why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/paras.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Grass"}|"Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life."|{"Paras"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/parasect.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Grass"}|"Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies
column3: they move onto another tree all at once."|{"Paras"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/venonat.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Poison"}|"Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin
column3: stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey."|{"Venonat"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/venomoth.gif|{"Bug"
column2: "Poison"}|"Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights
column3: attracted by the light in the darkness."|{"Venonat"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/diglett.gif|{"Ground"}|"Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple— wherever this Pokémon burrows
column2: the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables."|{"Diglett"

column1: http://pokestadium.com/sprites/xy/dugtrio.gif|{"Ground"}|"Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result
column2: each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly."|{"Diglett"
